data.text: An outdoor area set aside for recreation and play, especially one containing equipment such as seesaws and swings.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A field or sphere of unrestricted pleasurable activity.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A piece of ground set apart for open-air recreation; especially, such a piece of ground connected with a school, etc.
A piece of ground used for recreation.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A large open space to play on, usually for children.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: A <xref>yard</xref> or other open-air space on a school campus where the children can play, especially during breaks
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: Small area with dedicated play equipment, usually for children
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: Any physical or metaphysical space in which a person or organization has free rein to do as they please.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: yard consisting of an outdoor area for children's play
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.

data.text: an area where many people go for recreation
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
